questionText: (Man): I am so tired of studying. (Woman): Why don't we take a break and grab some coffee? (Narrator): What does the woman suggest?
(Woman): Did you finish the report? (Man): Not yet, I need more time. (Narrator): What does the man mean?
(Man): How was the movie? (Woman): It was a waste of time. (Narrator): What does the woman imply?
(Woman): Are you taking the bus? (Man): No, I think I'll walk today. The weather is nice. (Narrator): How will the man get to his destination?
(Man): I can't find my keys anywhere. (Woman): Did you check your coat pocket? (Narrator): What does the woman suggest?
(Woman): The professor cancelled class today. (Man): That's great! I can catch up on my reading. (Narrator): Why is the man happy?
(Man): Do you have change for a dollar? (Woman): Sorry, I only have big bills. (Narrator): What does the woman mean?
(Woman): This soup is too salty. (Man): I told you not to add that much salt. (Narrator): What happened to the soup?
(Man): When is the deadline? (Woman): It's due next Monday. (Narrator): When must the assignment be submitted?
(Woman): I think I'll wear the red dress. (Man): The blue one suits you better. (Narrator): What does the man prefer?
(Man): Is there a pharmacy nearby? (Woman): Yes, right across the street. (Narrator): Where is the pharmacy?
(Woman): Why are you whispering? (Man): Because we are in a library! (Narrator): Why is the man whispering?
optionC: They are in a quiet zone

questionText: (Man): Can you help me lift this box? (Woman): Sure, it looks heavy. (Narrator): What will the woman do?
(Woman): I passed my driving test! (Man): Congratulations! (Narrator): What is the good news?

(Woman): Have you seen my glasses? (Man): They are on your head. (Narrator): Where are the glasses?

(Man): I need to renew my passport. (Woman): You should do it before your trip. (Narrator): What does the man need to do?
(Woman): Who is that man over there? (Man): That's the new CEO. (Narrator): Who are they talking about?
(Man): I'm starving. (Woman): Let's grab a bite to eat. (Narrator): What does the man mean?
(Woman): Did you hear the news? (Man): No, what happened? (Narrator): What does the man want to know?
(Man): Can I borrow a pen? (Woman): Sorry, I only have one. (Narrator): Does the woman lend the pen?
(Woman): It's freezing in here. (Man): I'll close the window. (Narrator): Why is the woman cold?
(Man): Have you finished the book? (Woman): I'm only halfway through. (Narrator): How much has the woman read?
(Woman): What time is your flight? (Man): It leaves at six. (Narrator): When does the flight depart?
(Man): I bought a new car. (Woman): Wow, what color is it? (Narrator): What does the woman ask?
(Woman): Are you ready to order? (Man): I think I'll have the steak. (Narrator): Where does this conversation take place?

(Narrator): Listen to a conversation about a field trip. (Woman): The geology trip is this Saturday. (Man): Do we need to bring anything? (Woman): Just sturdy shoes and a notebook. (Man): What about lunch? (Woman): We'll stop at a diner. (Narrator): What do the students need to bring?
(Narrator): What is the main topic of the conversation?
(Narrator): When is the trip taking place?
(Narrator): Where will they eat lunch?

(Narrator): Listen to a part of a lecture in a history class. (Speaker): The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the late 1700s. It marked a major turning point in history. Hand production methods were replaced by machines. (Narrator): What is the lecture mainly about?
(Narrator): According to the speaker, where did it begin?
(Narrator): What replaced hand production methods?
(Narrator): When did it begin?

(Narrator): Listen to a conversation between a student and a librarian. (Student): I'm looking for books on marine biology. (Librarian): Those are in the science section, aisle 4. (Student): Can I check them out for two weeks? (Librarian): Yes, provided you have your student ID. (Narrator): What is the student looking for?
(Narrator): Where does the librarian direct the student?
(Narrator): What does the student need to check out books?
(Narrator): How long can the student keep the books?

(Narrator): Listen to a talk about honeybees. (Speaker): Honeybees are fascinating insects. They live in colonies with a single queen. Worker bees do all the work, from gathering nectar to defending the hive. Drones exist only to mate. (Narrator): What is the main topic?
(Narrator): How many queens are in a colony?
(Narrator): What is the function of the drone?
(Narrator): Who does all the work in the hive?

(Narrator): Listen to a conversation about a lost item. (Woman): I can't find my phone. (Man): Did you have it on the bus? (Woman): Yes, I was texting. (Man): Maybe it fell out of your pocket. (Narrator): What did the woman lose?
(Narrator): Where was she last using it?
(Narrator): What was she doing with it?
(Narrator): What does the man suggest happened?
optionC: It fell out of her pocket
